books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A novel about the disillusionment and excess of the Jazz Age, narrated by Nick Carraway, who is drawn into the opulent world of his mysterious neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: Set in the American South during the 1930s, it is a deeply moving novel about racial injustice and childhood innocence.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, where truth is subjective, and individuality is punished.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A classic romantic novel that explores the themes of love, class, and morality in 19th century England, centered on the dynamic Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: A novel narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager who recounts his experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: An epic sea story of Captain Ahab's voyage on the whaleship Pequod, driven by his obsession with the white whale Moby-Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A sweeping narrative that covers the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society through the stories of five Russian aristocratic families.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: A psychological exploration of the moral dilemmas faced by Rodion Raskolnikov, who believes he is above the law.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A complex novel in eight parts, dealing with themes of betrayal, faith, family, marriage, Imperial Russian society, desire, and rural vs. city life.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: The final novel by the Russian author Fyodor Dostoevsky, revolving around the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality.

books.title: Madame Bovary
books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.summary: The debut novel of French writer Gustave Flaubert, focusing on a doctor's wife, Emma Bovary, who has adulterous affairs and lives beyond her means.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.summary: Emily Brontë's only novel, it concerns the turbulent and tragic love story of Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.summary: A novel that follows the emotions and experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A novel about young scientist Victor Frankenstein who creates a grotesque but sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: The famous novel introducing Count Dracula, and the vampire mythos to popular culture.

books.title: A Tale of Two Cities
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.summary: Set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, the novel tells the story of the plight of the French peasantry, the brutality demonstrated by the revolutionaries, and the parallels in London society.

books.title: The Adventures of Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A direct sequel to 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer', the story follows young Huckleberry Finn and his journey down the Mississippi River.
books.publisher: Chatto & Windus / Charles L. Webster And Company

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: A children's fantasy novel that introduces the world of Middle-earth, following the quest of home-loving Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon, Smaug.
